dct_title_s: Map of Texas and the countries adjacent; compiled in the Bureau of the Corps of Topographical Engineers, from the best authorities. For the State Department, under the direction of Colonel J. J. Albert, Chief of the Corps; by W. H. Emory, 1st Lieut., T. E.
dct_description_sm: Prime meridians: Greenwich and Washington, DC. "Published by order of the U.S. Senate." Shows northern Mexico, southwestern U.S., and Texas as defined by Act of the Texian Congress, December 19, 1836; includes routes, Indian tribes, battle sites, etc. 1 map: part col.; 53 x 83 cm.
dct_creator_sm: United States. War Dept. Corps of Topographical Engineers.
dct_rights_sm: This map is in the public domain.
dct_rightsHolder_sm: Please attribute access and use of this digitized map to the Stephen S. Clark Library, University of Michigan Library. https://www.lib.umich.edu/about-us/policies/copyright-policy
